Is the following supposed to be able to work without changing hypothesis h to have m -1 instead of Nat.pred m (which are defeq)?

example (_ : 0 < n) (h : n ≤ Nat.pred m) : n < m := by
  change n ≤ m - 1 at h -- <-- FIXME: doesn't work without this
  omega

/cc @Kim Morrison

Yes, omega doesn't look inside pred, its your responsibility to get rid of it. (Indeed, perhaps I'd say there's an #xy problem here, and you should work out how to avoid talking about pred in the first place.)

Funnily enough I discovered today that omega didn't like pred when talking to a PhD student, and the reason we wanted to use it was because that a nat goal needed proving by splitting into cases n=0 and n=something+1, and we choose n.pred as the something and had no luck with omega, so choose n-1+1 and then things were fine :-)
Somo S. has marked this topic as resolved.
